question: MLB: Who will win Atlanta Braves v. Philadelphia Phillies, scheduled for July 25, 7:05 PM ET?
description:
In the upcoming MLB game scheduled for July 25, 7:05 PM ET:

If the Atlanta Braves win, this market will resolve to “Braves”.

If the Philadelphia Phillies win, this market will resolve to “Phillies”.

If the game is not completed by August 1 (11:59:59 PM ET), this market will resolve 50-50.

events.title: MLB: Who will win Atlanta Braves v. Philadelphia Phillies, scheduled for July 25, 7:05 PM ET?

question: Will Nancy Pelosi visit Taiwan before September 2022?
description:
Nancy Pelosi, Member of the US House of Representatives from California and present Speaker of the House, announced her intentions in April 2022 to visit Taiwan (Republic of China). Before she could initiate her trip, she tested positive for asymptomatic COVID-19, and her trip was postponed. She has since announced an intention to visit Taiwan in August.

Learning of this intended trip, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi was quoted in response: “If Pelosi, a political leader of the United States, knowingly visits Taiwan, it would be a malicious provocation against China’s sovereignty and gross interference in China’s internal affairs, and would send an extremely dangerous political signal to the outside world... If the United States insists on going its own way, China will surely make a firm response and the US side will bear all the consequences.”

This market asks whether Nancy Pelosi will visit Taiwan between July 25, 2022, and August 31, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET.

If Nancy Pelosi visits Taiwan between July 25, 2022, and August 31, 2022, 11:59:59 PM ET, this market will resolve to "Yes". Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purpose of this market, a "visit" is defined as Nancy Pelosi physically entering the terrestrial or maritime territory of Taiwan. Whether or not Nancy Pelosi enters Taiwanese airspace during the timeframe of this market will have no bearing on a positive resolution.

The primary resolution source for this information will be official information from government of the United States of America, official information from Nancy Pelosi or released by her verified social media accounts (e.g. https://twitter.com/SpeakerPelosi), and official information from Taiwan (e.g. https://www.taiwan.gov.tw/news.php); however, other credible reporting may be considered.

question: (Early Resolved) Will President Biden declare a new National Emergency before September?
description:
Under The National Emergencies Act of 1974 (enacted September 14, 1976, codified at 50 U.S.C. § 1601–1651), the President of the United States is empowered to activate special powers during a crisis. Congress has defined those statutory emergency powers, available to the President upon the declaration of an emergency (so called "National Emergency"). Congress also can terminate an emergency declaration with a joint resolution enacted into law.

This market will resolve to "Yes" if, within this market's timeframe, President Joe Biden declares a new National Emergency. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No". 

This market's timeframe spans from July 21 to August 31 (inclusive).

Please note for this market to resolve to "Yes" the national emergency declaration must be official, issued under authority of the National Emergencies Act by the Executive Office of the President, with a publication date within this market's timeframe. Any public announcement by President Biden without an official declaration will not suffice to resolve this market to "Yes". 

A continuation of any existing National Emergencies will not suffice to resolve this market to "Yes". An executive emergency order which is not subject to the provisions of the National Emergencies Act will not suffice to resolve this market to "Yes".  

The primary resolution source for this market will be the Federal Register of official documents published by the Executive Office of the President (https://www.federalregister.gov/agencies/executive-office-of-the-president), however other official government sources may be used.
